node.title: Cops face being stood down over COVID jab refusal as more than 200 yet to get first dose
node.description: All constabulary staff, authorised officers and recruits must have had their first shot by the end of the weekend.
node.content: ["More than 200 police officers are yet to get their first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine.\n", "All constabulary staff, authorised officers and recruits must have had their first shot by the end of the weekend.", "As of Friday, 98 percent of the 10,500 staff covered by the mandate have had one vaccination.", "Police said a small number of staff members were expected to be stood down on Monday.", "Discussions will be held with the workers regarding redeployment, leave without pay or medical exemptions.", "Meanwhile, firefighters had until the end of Friday to get both jabs.", "Fire and Emergency New Zealand (FENZ) said as of Friday afternoon about 95 percent of paid employees were fully vaccinated and nearly 2 percent had had one dose.", "Almost 90 percent of volunteers were fully vaccinated and nearly 3 percent were partially covered.", "In November last year, there were 900 unvaccinated police staff members.", "FENZ said it was confident it would be able to continue to respond and keep communities safe.", "About 80 percent of the more than 10,000 firefighting staff in New Zealand are volunteers.", "Last year FENZ said on Twitter it would be responding to emergencies in all COVID-19 protection levels.", "FENZ said its staff on call-outs would wear face coverings and practice physical distancing where possible.", "RNZ"]
